pageContext.claim: “We're largely out of Iraq. We're down to a very few soldiers. I said we're getting out of these endless wars -- these ridiculous, endless wars.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. footprint in Iraq is a fraction of what it was once. Last month, Gen. Kenneth F. McKenzie Jr., the commander of the military’s Central Command announced it would cut troop levels in half from 5,200 to 3,000 — still that is not “few.”
